title: How to Subtract Fractions from Whole Numbers

steps.title: Convert the whole number to a fraction.
steps.content: Convert the whole number to a fraction. To do this, give the whole number a denominator of 1. [1] X Research source Example: 8 − 4 5 {\displaystyle 8-{\frac {4}{5}}} = 8 1 − 4 5 {\displaystyle ={\frac {8}{1}}-{\frac {4}{5}}}

steps.title: Convert to fractions of like denominators.
steps.content: Convert to fractions of like denominators. The original fraction's denominator is also the least common denominator (LCD) of the two fractions. Multiply the top and bottom of the "whole number fraction" by this number so the fractions have the same denominator. [2] X Research source 8 1 − 4 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {8}{1}}-{\frac {4}{5}}} = 8 ∗ 5 1 ∗ 5 − 4 5 {\displaystyle ={\frac {8*5}{1*5}}-{\frac {4}{5}}} = 40 5 − 4 5 {\displaystyle ={\frac {40}{5}}-{\frac {4}{5}}}

steps.title: Subtract the numerators.
steps.content: Subtract the numerators. Now that the fractions have the same denominators, you can treat the numerators as a normal subtraction problem: [3] X Research source 40 5 − 4 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {40}{5}}-{\frac {4}{5}}} = 40 − 4 5 {\displaystyle ={\frac {40-4}{5}}} = 36 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {36}{5}}}

steps.title: Convert to a mixed number (optional)
steps.content: Convert to a mixed number (optional) . If your answer is an improper fraction, you may need to rewrite it as a mixed number: [4] X Research source Example: Rewrite 36 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {36}{5}}} as a mixed number. How many times does 5 fit evenly into 36? 5 x 7 = 35, so the whole number portion is 7 . What's left over? The whole number portion is equivalent to 35 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {35}{5}}} , so solve 36 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {36}{5}}} - 35 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {35}{5}}} = 1 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {1}{5}}} Combine the whole number and fraction: 36 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {36}{5}}} = 7 1 5 {\displaystyle 7{\frac {1}{5}}}

steps.title: Try this for large whole numbers.
steps.content: Try this for large whole numbers. Did you see how the method above converts the whole number into a fraction, then converts back to a mixed number at the end? This method lets you skip some of that so the fraction only involves smaller numbers.

steps.title: Convert improper fractions to mixed numbers
steps.content: Convert improper fractions to mixed numbers . Skip this step if your fraction is not improper. (An improper fraction has a larger number on top than on bottom.) [5] X Research source Example: 11 − 4 3 {\displaystyle 11-{\frac {4}{3}}} = 11 − 1 1 3 {\displaystyle =11-1{\frac {1}{3}}} = 10 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =10-{\frac {1}{3}}}

steps.title: Separate the whole number into 1 and another whole number.
steps.content: Separate the whole number into 1 and another whole number. For example, rewrite 5 as 4 + 1, or rewrite 22 as 21 + 1. 10 − 1 3 {\displaystyle 10-{\frac {1}{3}}} = 9 + 1 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+1-{\frac {1}{3}}}

steps.title: Convert the 1 into a fraction.
steps.content: Convert the 1 into a fraction. At this point we're using the method above to solve the part of the problem in the form "1 - (fraction)". The other whole number will stay the same for the rest of the problem. = 9 + 1 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+1-{\frac {1}{3}}} = 9 + 1 1 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+{\frac {1}{1}}-{\frac {1}{3}}}

steps.title: Multiply to give the fractions like denominators.
steps.content: Multiply to give the fractions like denominators. As described above, multiply the top and bottom of your new fraction so it has the same denominator as the original fraction. = 9 + 1 ∗ 3 1 ∗ 3 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+{\frac {1*3}{1*3}}-{\frac {1}{3}}} = 9 + 3 3 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+{\frac {3}{3}}-{\frac {1}{3}}}

steps.title: Combine the two fractions.
steps.content: Combine the two fractions. Subtract the numerators to solve the fraction part of the equation. = 9 + 3 − 1 3 {\displaystyle =9+{\frac {3-1}{3}}} = 9 + 2 3 {\displaystyle =9+{\frac {2}{3}}} = 9 2 3 {\displaystyle =9{\frac {2}{3}}}
